snippet: Narcotics were smuggled into the United States by being stuffed inside food like empanadas and sesame candy and by soaking paper with liquid cocaine, prosecutors in New York said.
abstract: Federal prosecutors in Manhattan accuse Jorge Guerrero and five others from Ecuador of smuggling narcotics into the United States by stuffing cocaine and heroin inside food and by soaking paper with liquid cocaine; Guerrero, who pleads not guilty, faces up to 20 years in prison.

byline.original: By ERIC P. NEWCOMER and VIVIAN YEE

lead_paragraph: Narcotics were smuggled into the United States by being stuffed inside food like empanadas and sesame candy and by soaking paper with liquid cocaine, prosecutors in New York said.

headline.seo: 6 Accused of Smuggling Drugs in Candy and Diplomas
headline.main: 6 Hid Drugs in Diplomas and Candy, Officials Say
headline.print_headline: 6 Hid Drugs In Diplomas And Candy, Officials Say
